description: The course addresses the theory and practical application of F. M. Alexander's discoveries
about the process of human coordination.  Students learn to apply the Alexander Technique to their
practice and performance activities.  Offered annually in the spring semester.
This course explores physiological approaches to well-being in performing artists. Students
examine how their own physiological systems are organized in activity; learn how to overcome
tension and anxiety when performing and to teach others how to do so; and develop optimum
coordination and wellness as musicians. Offered annually spring semester.
fullname: Liberating Performers: Beyond the Alexander Technique
